casebody.data:
Third Department,

September, 1964

(September 15, 1964) In the Matter of J. Daniel Mahoney, Individually and as State Chairman and Chairman of the State Committee of the Conservative Party, Appellant, v. John P. Lomenzo, as Secretary of State of the State of New York, et al., Respondents. Per Curiam.

Presidential electors are, in our view, “candidates for election to public office”. (Election Law, §§ 130, 131, subd. 1; § 139, subd. 1.) We pass on no other question. Order affirmed, without costs. Gibson, P. J., Herlihy, Reynolds, Taylor and Hamm, JJ., concur. [43 Misc 2d 1094.]
